short_summary: Reconstruction work in Harbour Le Cou Newfoundland and Labrador due to damage caused by storm Fiona
description: Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has a contract on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) for storm damage reconstruction at Harbour Le Cou, Newfoundland and Labrador by furnishing all plant, labor, equipment and material... etc.
duration_in_months: a pre-defined duration of 52 months from contract award
full_summary:
# Harbour Le Cou Fiona Storm Damage Reconstruction Project

**Project Title:** 
Fiona Storm Damage Reconstruction – Harbour Le Cou, Newfoundland and Labrador

**Contract Title:**
Réparations des dommages causés par la tempête Fiona – Harbour Le Cou (Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador)

**Project Reference:**
WS4172804738-Doc4172817000

**Current Status:** 
Expired Tender

**Index Terms:**

* UNSPSC Code: 72141200 - Marine construction services
* UNSPSC Description: Maintenance and repair of marine construction and structures
* Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* End User: Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)
* Location: Harbour Le Cou, Newfoundland and Labrador

**Project Description:**
The Department of Public Works and Government Services, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans, is seeking proposals for the Fiona Storm Damage Reconstruction project at Harbour Le Cou, Newfoundland and Labrador. This project involves the furnishing of all necessary plant, labour, equipment, and materials to repair storm damage in the Harbour Le Cou area. The expected completion date is 52 weeks after the contract is awarded.

**Key Requirements:**

* Project stakeholders include the Department of Public Works and Government Services, the Department of Fisheries and Oceans, and other relevant government agencies.
* All tenders must comply with the Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) regulations.
* The contract value is estimated to be between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000.

**Important Documents:**
The official tender notice can be found at: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17323821?extsite=MTczMjM4MjFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Contact:**
Adam Beaumaster, SPAC/PSPC
Email: adam.beaumaster@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Please note that the procurement method for this project is competitive and open bidding. The lowest price will be the primary factor used to select the successful bidder. 

---

You should respond in the same structure format shown. Please remember to use guildelines such as proper names, verbs should be at third person and adapt the tone appropriately. 

A list aof possible SDK's to check your output here:
* https://wwwekyll
